quick_answer.text: One spoon (tsp) of brown sugar contains about 15 kcal, primarily from carbohydrates.

faqs.q: How many calories in one spoon of brown sugar?
faqs.a: About 15 kcal for one teaspoon serving.

faqs.q: Is brown sugar higher in calories than white sugar?
faqs.a: No, similar at ~15 kcal per tsp; brown has slight molasses flavor but comparable nutrition.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in one spoon of brown sugar?
faqs.a: Approximately 3.9 g carbs, all from sugars, with 0 g fiber.

faqs.q: Does brown sugar have any protein or fat?
faqs.a: Negligible—0 g protein and 0 g fat per teaspoon.

faqs.q: How does spoon size affect calories in brown sugar?
faqs.a: Teaspoon (~4 g) is 15 kcal; tablespoon (~12 g) is about 52 kcal—measure precisely.
